title: Fire Safety Engineering Fundamentals: Cognitive Load Optimization and Constructivist-Based Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of engineering mathematics and physics
context.additional_context: A systematically structured course for learners with diverse academic backgrounds to acquire core concepts of fire safety engineering, with enhanced interactivity through digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can explain fire dynamics principles (pyrolysis, flame spread) and apply them to practical scenarios
Learners can compare fire safety design standards for different building structures and construct risk assessment models
Learners experience learning methods that involve establishing fire response strategies and managing cognitive load through team-based simulations

resources: Fire Safety Engineering Practice Kit (Smoke Diffusion Model, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
